column5: How does the nervous system control voluntary movement? What are the benefits of exercise? And are these things the same for all people? Find out in this programme.The two-year Master's programme is meant for students who are fascinated by the complexity of human movement. You will study human movement from multiple perspectives, using theories from Medicine, Biology, Mathematics and Behavioural Sciences.In this programme, you will acquire an advanced theoretical understanding of human movement. You will also gain research skills and professional skills, learning to apply your knowledge in a practical setting.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
